intro: Linkia striata, commonly known as the striped sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Indo-Pacific region. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a striking green and white striped pattern. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in shallow marine environments. Linkia striata plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various marine organisms.
